definition: to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: All the panes of glass in the world today cover about four billion square metres.
sentences.chinese: 如今全世界所有玻璃板总计约有四十亿平方米。
我们飞行了625个架次，总计1371个小时。

sentences.english: This is your money. Total is RMB￥8500.00, please check.
sentences.chinese: 这是您的钱，总计8500元人民币，请点一下。

sentences.english: A total of 1062 women participated in the study.
sentences.chinese: 总计1062名妇女参加了本项研究。

sentences.english: Results:86 rib fracture in 50 cases were showed.
sentences.chinese: 结果50例患者，总计86处肋骨骨折。

sentences.english: The trip takes three months in total.
sentences.chinese: 整段行程总计达三个月之久。

sentences.english: But, says Moynihan, the figures are grand totals.
sentences.chinese: 但是，莫伊尼汉说这总计数据。

sentences.english: The Main Assembly Room lies in the South Building, with capacity of 2051 persons.
sentences.chinese: 主会场位于南楼，总计观众座席2051个。

sentences.english: The four grants announced today total US$ 12.9 million.
sentences.chinese: 今天宣布的四笔资助金总计达1290万美元。

sentences.english: C: Here you are.Your bill totals RMB 3500 Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 这里，您的账单总计人民币3500元。

sentences.english: The gas bill totted up to ￡50.
Inviting everyone out to dinner would run into a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 邀请每个人出去吃晚饭总计要花很多钱。

sentences.english: The judge said the assets amounted to(3) just over 131 million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 法官说他的全部身家总计超过一亿三千万镑。

sentences.english: Total paid circulation is gone as the top-line measure.
sentences.chinese: 以前最主要的评定办法总计购买发行量已经过时了。

sentences.english: Together their net wealth ― assets minus debts ― amounts to $426 billion.
sentences.chinese: 他们的净资产加起来除去负债，总计4260亿美元。

definition: to add up the total/to figure what sth amounts to/to consider
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
up to/no less than/as much as
Gundam, Japanese animation franchise/Jean-Luc Godard (1930-), French-Swiss film director
to convert into/to amount to/to be equivalent to
